alert.note: Alert for Placer; Sacramento; Sutter; Yolo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 22 at 6:53PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Placer. In northern California, Sacramento, Sutter and Yolo. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Showers and isolated thunderstorms continue to move over the area. Rainfall over the past 6 hours has ranged from 0.50 to 2.00 inches. An additional 0.50 inches is possible through 11 pm. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sacramento, Roseville, Citrus Heights, Folsom, Rocklin, Carmichael, Fair Oaks, Rancho Cordova, Lincoln, North Highlands, Elverta, Antelope, Foothill Farms, Rio Linda, Pleasant Grove, Arco Arena, Gold River, Orangevale, Granite Bay and Arden-Arcade. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
